result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan L Robinson

records.addlTxt: Letter/correspondence from defendant.  (Donovan L. Robinson, 3150 N Palmer St, Milwaukee WI 53212).
Letter from defendant re:  Acceptance of Appointment of Counsel and Request for Service.  (Donovan L. Robinson, 3150 N Palmer St, Milwaukee WI 53212).

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Donovan L Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Jury Trial. Defense motion to adjourn GRANTED.  The Court addresses the most recent filing by the Defendant. The Court find the document fails to provide any legal basis and therefore takes no legal action. The court adjourns this matter for further Final Pretrial and Jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Bill of Complaint In Equity Presentment to Void Proceedings and Jurisdiction, received and filed.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Donovan L Robinson.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-Trial. Final Pretrial proceeded. Case remains in a jury trial posture. States offer put on the record.  Defendant rejects States offer.  Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to Amended Charge. Court will only accept any plea negotiations as to all counts.  Court will not delay or adjourn the trial for any reasoning that could have been known by today. No objection to either State or Defense Motions in Limine; Motions GRANTED.  Pretrial check list placed on the record.  Both parties are to have exhibit lists prepared by jury trial date and know how to operate any equipment if needed.

Court in receipt of Bill of Complaint in Equity Presentment to Void Proceedings and Jurisdiction from Defendant.  Copy provided to the State.  Court will review and take up this matter on the scheduled Jury Trial date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Jury Trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 6/15/2022 ( 23 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn. Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion to withdraw.  Attorney Lori Kuehn informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw DENIED by the Court due to reasons stated on the record. Previous deadlines set by the court remains in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 17 for a pre-trial conference on July 1st, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Court in receipt of a motion to withdraw from defense. Court scheduled a motion hearing date with parties via email correspondense. Court scheduled June 15th, 2022, at 8:15 am for a motion to withdraw hearing. Notice of court hearing sent to defendant via mail.
Received and Filed. Exhibit A - Termination of Counsel

Affidavit Rebuttal

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Castel Housen. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court schedules Final Pre-Trial, Jury Trial, and Motion Hearing dates, and sets the following deadlines: 06/10/2022 deadline for the exchange of discovery. 07/11/2022 deadline for filing any motions. 07/29/2022 deadline for the state to submit crime lab analysis to defense. 09/06/2022 deadline for filing change of plea forms. 09/12/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. State has until June 6th, 2022 to share any discovery with defense minus any crime lab reports. Defense has until June 27th, 2022, to file any change of plea forms or any motions. Case adjourned to Branch17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed. Mailed to pro se defendant.
Signed and filed.

Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Christopher L Morgan.
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by  counsel and petitioner. Exhibit 2 received. Court ordered an amended order that the Milwaukee County Sheriff's department shall return $612.00 to the petitioner. Case adjourned to Branch 17.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an indigency hearing. Defendant requesting represent himself. Defendant refused to participate in calloquy with the court. Due to reasons stated on the record, court is going to appoint a defense attorney to represent the defendant at county expense. Defendant objects. Court notes defendant's objection. Case adjourned to Branch 17 for a status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.

This court form is specifically for a court order for return of a firearm. The property the court ordered returned in this case is a phone and money, not a firearm. The court will issue a different order regarding the defendant's petition for return of property filed on April 5, 2022.
Return of property hearing on April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
order regarding petition for return of property

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Matter before the Court for Return of Property Petition.  Petitioner appears.  Christopher Morgan appears for the City of Milwaukee, State of Wisconsin. Petitioner provided proof of ownership.  State has no legal basis in which the seized property in police inventory cannot be returned. Court partially grants petitioner request and Ordered the property returned. For reasons stated on the record, court informs the petitioner that the owner of the Iphone 13 will have to submit an petition for return of property. Exhibit 1 moved in and received.  Case remains set for Indigency Hearing on 4/27/22 at 8:15am.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant at this time waived his right to attorney. Statements by parties.  The Court ordered this matter adjourned to 4/27/22 at 8:15, in person to continue discussion with defendant regarding his request to waive attorney.  mn  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared via zoom.  Court passed this matter to allow defendant to appear in person in room 316 of the safety building at 10:30. mn

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donovan L Robinson in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Donovan L Robinson in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan L Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
